headline: Is It Too Late To Consider AMD After Its Huge AI Fueled 2025 Rally?
summary: Wondering if Advanced Micro Devices is still worth buying after its huge run, or if the real upside has already been priced in? The stock has been choppy in the short term, up 1.8% over the last week but down 9.2% over the last month, yet it is still up a massive 83.6% year to date and 70.1% over the past year, with gains of 221.2% over 3 years and 128.6% over 5 years reshaping how investors see its growth and risk. Recently, the market has been focused on AMD's aggressive push into AI...

headline: Oracle and the Fed Were Expected to Provide Wall Street With Answers. Only One Delivered.
summary: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell’s answer to a crucial question on interest rates stoked big gains for stocks on Wednesday, but bigger concerns over a query put to executives at  Oracle  looked set to unwind nearly all of them.  The Fed lowered its benchmark borrowing rate for a third consecutive meeting, taking it to between 3.5% and 3.75% and forecast a further quarter-point reduction in 2026.  Powell told reporters that risks to the central bank’s dual mandate for full employment and steady prices were largely balanced but noted that delayed data from the 43-day U.S. government shutdown still will need to be assessed.

content.title: Oracle and the Fed Were Expected to Provide Wall Street With Answers. Only One Delivered.
content.summary: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell’s answer to a crucial question on interest rates stoked big gains for stocks on Wednesday, but bigger concerns over a query put to executives at  Oracle  looked set to unwind nearly all of them.  The Fed lowered its benchmark borrowing rate for a third consecutive meeting, taking it to between 3.5% and 3.75% and forecast a further quarter-point reduction in 2026.  Powell told reporters that risks to the central bank’s dual mandate for full employment and steady prices were largely balanced but noted that delayed data from the 43-day U.S. government shutdown still will need to be assessed.

headline: Oracle shares tumble as gloomy forecasts, higher capex reignite AI bubble concerns
summary: Oracle shares slumped nearly 12% on Thursday, dragging other technology stocks, as concerns mounted about the company's massive AI spending and ​the lack of a clear timeline on returns from the investments.  Its peers such ‌as Nvidia, Microsoft , Micron, and CoreWeave  were down between 0.4% and 4.4% in premarket trading.  In a bid ⁠to compete with industry giants ‌like Amazon, Microsoft and Google, Oracle has signed cloud-computing deals with OpenAI and others which has helped the stock climb nearly 34% this year.

content.title: Oracle shares tumble as gloomy forecasts, higher capex reignite AI bubble concerns
content.summary: Oracle shares slumped nearly 12% on Thursday, dragging other technology stocks, as concerns mounted about the company's massive AI spending and ​the lack of a clear timeline on returns from the investments.  Its peers such ‌as Nvidia, Microsoft , Micron, and CoreWeave  were down between 0.4% and 4.4% in premarket trading.  In a bid ⁠to compete with industry giants ‌like Amazon, Microsoft and Google, Oracle has signed cloud-computing deals with OpenAI and others which has helped the stock climb nearly 34% this year.

headline: Oracle Stock Tumbles After Earnings Smashed Estimates. This Is Driving the Selloff.
summary: Financial guidance that came in short of estimates and increased spending on artificial-intelligence infrastructure look to be worrying investors.  Adjusted earnings per share were $2.26, well ahead of Wall Street’s consensus estimate of $1.64, up from $1.47 last year.  The big beat was largely driven by the company’s sale of its interest in the Ampere chip company to SoftBank for $2.7 billion, boosting pretax earnings by 91 cents a diluted share.

content.title: Oracle Stock Tumbles After Earnings Smashed Estimates. This Is Driving the Selloff.
content.summary: Financial guidance that came in short of estimates and increased spending on artificial-intelligence infrastructure look to be worrying investors.  Adjusted earnings per share were $2.26, well ahead of Wall Street’s consensus estimate of $1.64, up from $1.47 last year.  The big beat was largely driven by the company’s sale of its interest in the Ampere chip company to SoftBank for $2.7 billion, boosting pretax earnings by 91 cents a diluted share.

headline: These are the key AI players on the cover of Time's 'Architects of AI' magazine
summary: Accompanying Time's annual person of the year selection Thursday is a magazine cover that resembles the “Lunch Atop a Skyscraper” photograph from the 1930s showing eight of the “ Architects of AI ” sitting on the beam.  “This was the year when artificial intelligence’s full potential roared into view, and when it became clear that there will be no turning back or opting out,” Time editor-in-chief Sam Jacobs wrote in an explanation of the choice.  The magazine was deliberate in selecting people — the “individuals who imagined, designed, and built AI” — rather than the technology itself.

content.title: These are the key AI players on the cover of Time's 'Architects of AI' magazine
content.summary: Accompanying Time's annual person of the year selection Thursday is a magazine cover that resembles the “Lunch Atop a Skyscraper” photograph from the 1930s showing eight of the “ Architects of AI ” sitting on the beam.  “This was the year when artificial intelligence’s full potential roared into view, and when it became clear that there will be no turning back or opting out,” Time editor-in-chief Sam Jacobs wrote in an explanation of the choice.  The magazine was deliberate in selecting people — the “individuals who imagined, designed, and built AI” — rather than the technology itself.

headline: Explainer-What are credit default swaps and why are investors watching Oracle's?
summary: The cost of insuring Oracle's debt against the risk of default has shot up after its latest earnings reignited worries about how much the broader corporate sector is spending on AI and the borrowing surge to fund it.  Trading in ‌Oracle credit default swaps (CDS), which has exploded in the last year and are near their most expensive on record, tell a less upbeat story than its shares.  Bond investors hope to receive interest on their bonds and their money back when the bond matures.

content.title: Explainer-What are credit default swaps and why are investors watching Oracle's?
content.summary: The cost of insuring Oracle's debt against the risk of default has shot up after its latest earnings reignited worries about how much the broader corporate sector is spending on AI and the borrowing surge to fund it.  Trading in ‌Oracle credit default swaps (CDS), which has exploded in the last year and are near their most expensive on record, tell a less upbeat story than its shares.  Bond investors hope to receive interest on their bonds and their money back when the bond matures.

headline: Rivian debuts custom self-driving chip, $2,500 driver-assistance package
summary: Rivian Automotive on Thursday unveiled its first custom computer chip for self-driving, shifting away from Nvidia's processors, and a new paid ​driver-assistance package called Autonomy+, as the electric-vehicle maker leans on artificial intelligence to boost revenue.  The announcements, ‌made at Rivian's first Autonomy and AI Day, come as carmakers worldwide pour billions into AI systems that power long-awaited self-driving technologies ‌that have faced several technical challenges.  Rivian said its longer-term goal is Level 4 autonomy, in which a vehicle can operate without human input in certain conditions, and that its new foundational AI model trained on vast amounts of real and simulated driving data, called the Large Driving Model, will underpin those efforts.

content.title: Rivian debuts custom self-driving chip, $2,500 driver-assistance package
content.summary: Rivian Automotive on Thursday unveiled its first custom computer chip for self-driving, shifting away from Nvidia's processors, and a new paid ​driver-assistance package called Autonomy+, as the electric-vehicle maker leans on artificial intelligence to boost revenue.  The announcements, ‌made at Rivian's first Autonomy and AI Day, come as carmakers worldwide pour billions into AI systems that power long-awaited self-driving technologies ‌that have faced several technical challenges.  Rivian said its longer-term goal is Level 4 autonomy, in which a vehicle can operate without human input in certain conditions, and that its new foundational AI model trained on vast amounts of real and simulated driving data, called the Large Driving Model, will underpin those efforts.

headline: SpaceX $1.5T value target hinges on Starlink — and Elon
summary: SpaceX is planning an initial public offering that may be the world’s biggest ever.  Of listed firms with similar characteristics, only Palantir Technologies Inc. comes close, at about 70 times.  The near-term investment case is that Starlink and a nascent mobile phone service fueled by its acquisition of spectrum from EchoStar Corp. provide the foundation for the outsize growth that IPO buyers will demand.

content.title: SpaceX $1.5T value target hinges on Starlink — and Elon
content.summary: SpaceX is planning an initial public offering that may be the world’s biggest ever.  Of listed firms with similar characteristics, only Palantir Technologies Inc. comes close, at about 70 times.  The near-term investment case is that Starlink and a nascent mobile phone service fueled by its acquisition of spectrum from EchoStar Corp. provide the foundation for the outsize growth that IPO buyers will demand.

Disney (DIS) is investing $1 billion in OpenAI (OPAI.PVT). Rivian (RIVN) unveiled in-house artificial intelligence (AI) chips for autonomous driving to replace Nvidia (NVDA) chips. The big beat was largely driven by the company’s sale of its interest in the Ampere chip company to SoftBank for $2.7 billion, boosting pretax earnings by 91 cents a diluted share.

headline: What are credit default swaps and why are investors watching Oracle's?
summary: The cost of insuring Oracle's debt against the risk of default has shot up after its latest earnings reignited worries about how much the broader corporate sector is spending on AI and the borrowing surge to fund it.  Trading in ‌Oracle credit default swaps (CDS), which has exploded in the last year and are near their most expensive on record, tell a less upbeat story than its shares.  Bond investors hope to receive interest on their bonds and their money back when the bond matures.

content.title: What are credit default swaps and why are investors watching Oracle's?
content.summary: The cost of insuring Oracle's debt against the risk of default has shot up after its latest earnings reignited worries about how much the broader corporate sector is spending on AI and the borrowing surge to fund it.  Trading in ‌Oracle credit default swaps (CDS), which has exploded in the last year and are near their most expensive on record, tell a less upbeat story than its shares.  Bond investors hope to receive interest on their bonds and their money back when the bond matures.
